package.description: A set of multiplexing tools. mux can take a bunch of arbitrary-typed nodes and multiplex between them. Useful anywhere a mux is useful in circuits or HDL... as one example, deciding which algorithm gets control of the drive system of the robot. You only want one algorithm to drive the robot at any time, and need a nice way to switch between who is actually passing messages to the robot and whose messages are getting ignored. throttle will subscribe to a topic and republish it on another topic, at a maximum rate.
package.author: Morgan Quigley, Brian Gerkey
